purpose: The code appears to collect system information including MAC addresses and hostname, then sends this data to remote servers for tracking purposes.
flows: network interfaces -> macAddresses -> base64 encoded string
anomalies: Use of hardcoded C2 domains in array _tmp_2
Sending system identifiers to external domains without user consent
Use of rejectUnauthorized: false in HTTP request configuration
analysis: This code performs system fingerprinting by collecting MAC addresses, hostname, and user info. It then establishes outbound HTTP connections to known command-and-control domains. The use of rejectUnauthorized: false indicates potential TLS bypass, and the hardcoded domains suggest malicious behavior typical of tracking or surveillance software.
conclusion: This code exhibits characteristics of malicious tracking software that collects system information and communicates it to external servers.
